radiographic_examinations.findings: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no suspicious solid liver mass. A small cyst is incidentally noted at the dome of the liver measuring 1.9 x 1.3 x 1.6 cm. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites in the upper abdomen. There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CBD measures 3 mm. There is no evidence of stones or gallbladder wall thickening. The head, body and tail of the pancreas are within normal limits, without masses or pancreatic ductal dilatation. Normal echogenicity of the spleen, measuring 14.6 cm. The right kidney measures 11.4 cm. The left kidney measures 11.8 cm. Normal cortical echogenicity and corticomedullary differentiation is seen bilaterally. There is no evidence of masses, stones, or hydronephrosis in the kidneys. The proximal aorta demonstrates normal caliber however the distal aorta is not visualized. The visualized portion of the IVC is within normal limits.
